text: Niconza was a community, now extinct, in Perry Township, Miami County, in the U.S. state of Indiana. ==History== A post office was established at Niconza in 1838, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1881. The community served as a trading post in Perry Township's early history. ==References== Category:Geography of Miami County, Indiana Category:Former populated places in Indiana Category:Ghost towns in Indiana
title: Niconza, Indiana
